RIP Neal - You will be missed. I only knew you for such a short time, but your spirit shall be with me for always. I have never seen a love truer than the love that you and Pat had, that lasted through hardships one can only imagine. You were the most wonderful father to your children, a most loving husband and a wonderful caring grandfather. It is rare to meet a truly kind spirit, but we are all blessed for having known you.

Have been back from the airport for about 90mins now and am still miserable. For those that dont know, my best friend and her family moved today.... some 5000km away. She gave me an early birthday pressie when I got there and that set me off. I'm glad one of us brought tissues! Her mum was there and trying to hold it all together, rather unsucessfully, and when they got on the plane she just sat down and sobbed. Kids were totally unaware, they really had no idea of what was going on and the distances involved.

*sniff* I feel very alone now.

Insert brain here ----->> *

You may now return to your regularly scheduled programme.

Have just made the yummiest home made muesli bars... and best yet, they are gluten free and AB#3 likes them! Very simple too with lots of fibre (something hard to get on a GF diet).

1 cup gluten free rice bubbles
1 cup dessicated coconut
1/2 cup rice bran (I chopped them up a bit)
1 cup sugar (I used fructose - lower GI, not as sweet)
1/2 cup chopped dried apricots
1/2 cup chopped pecans (I used walnuts - as I had them)
1 Tbls psyllium husks (opt. - for fibre)

4oz butter
1oz honey.

Mix dried ingredients in a bowl.
Melt butter and honey and pour over dried ingredients.
Mix well and press into a lightly greased slice tray.

Bake at about 180c (375f) until golden (time will vary depending on size of tin... but around 15mins)
Let cool and cut into bars.

I think I might try it with dried apple and sultanas next time!

The school choir (of which my eldest 2 anklebiters are members of) are doing a medley, and the teacher is looking for a specific 80's "sound". She is looking for that typical 80's electronic keyboard/drums sound. Kind of boppy and upbeat but reasonably easy to sing. The choir is by audition only and is very good (state representatives) so it doesn't have to be tooo simple. Problem is that teacher is too young to be an 80's kid lol. 

A couple of things I have thought of so far -

Thomas Dolby - She Blinded me with Science
Eddie Grant - Electric Avenue
De Barge - Rythym of the Night.

Any suggestions please???

Feeling rather tired tonight. Had to pay for AB#2's piano lessons which she is getting diddly squat out of. Nice teacher, but just smiles sweetly and lets kids do what they want. Sorry - fuck that - if she wants to fart arse around, she can do it at home, and not for $20 for 30mins!! Spent afternoon singing pirates of penzance songs too which was V. nice. Long time since I have done any proper singing. Sang with kids in car too... scary that AB#4 can sing along with most ABBA and Village People songs! There was a lady at the music school buying some reeds for her clarinet, which of course made me all nostalgic for mine. But buggered if I have $160 to repair mine! Hell I could buy one for less than that. lol.

Anklebiters now in bed. 3 of them V unimpressed with me as they were (supposedly) watching Pirates of the Caribbean. Of course when I found them all playing in the bedrooms I sent them to bed to cries of "But we're watching the movie!!"

Haha! Evil bitch mummy strikes again!

Decided tomorrow is day from hell. Have to have AB#1 at school by 7.45 for a University Exam... then leave the middle 2 there and have #1 to his gifted programme by 9am and AB#4 to his special school by 9am. I might add the latter 2 are 30mins drive away! Of course AB#3 has to eat at exactly 7.30am... so not sure how I will figure this yet. Last time I fed her early and ended up having to pick her up at 10 in a severe hypo. *shrug* 

If there is no rest for the wicked, then I must be pure evil! Mwahahaha!

*snort*

Oh... and if any of you dont read <lj user="shiv5468">'s journal (and why the hell don't you???) then get over there pronto and read it!! Her latest update is brilliant and her drabble had me spitting tea on the keyboard. Not to mention the added picture!

You're Colombia!
You do a lot of drugs, and these have kind of distorted your view of reality, to the point that everyone looks like an enemy.  You keep trying to restore order over your schizophrenic world view, but you don't even know which goal is your own and which is someone else's.  You're pretty sure someone needs to be punished for all this, but who that is changes all the time.  Things would be a lot better for you if you switched to coffee, or even to decaf, but all this money would be hard to give up.
Take the Country Quiz at the Blue Pyramid

 and...


You're Ulysses!
by James Joyce
Most people are convinced that you don't make any sense, but compared to what else you could say, what you're saying now makes tons of sense. What people do understand about you is your vulgarity, which has convinced people that you are at once brilliant and repugnant. Meanwhile you are content to wander around aimlessly, taking in the sights and sounds of the city. What you see is vast, almost limitless, and brings you additional fame. When no one is looking, you dream of being a Greek folk hero.
 Take the Book Quiz at the Blue Pyramid.

While chatting about accents with and searching the web... I came across this.. just about had me in stitches!! Scots: C'moan hen Alias, ya ken thuss accent vairy whale! Averyboady kens et the wurruld over. Ah cannae see any mair aboot et thun thaht. Geordie: Why-aye Ehlius, pet. Thissun is a reet canny ak-sent, lake. W'all uv us seeya 'lake' at the end uv evry sentuns, lake. Ah divven't knaa why, lake. It meenz 'like' bah tha weeya. Boot wa divven't pronoonce it thut weeya, lake. Cockney: Awroight Alias, sweedar'! Wewcome to Laandan! Capitaw ci'y an aw vat carry on. This is ve cheeriest, chirpiest, cheekiest accent in the 'ole of Inglund, bibe. We aw dawnce on ve tibles in good owd Laandan taan, not like vem stoopid bleedn norven mankeys wotuh aw-ways gaan on abaat veir stoopid riney wevver an tha'. Tike it azey, twinkoow! Ta-ra! Scouse: Aaright, aaright, Alias. Moasht peepl tenk dat deh Liverpewl akhsent shoundsh a bit, likhe, scally an' da. Bot us Scoushers know da dis is de, likhe, BESHT akhsent. An' we inventud aal de best bands an' da. Ey, ey, ey, youse lot! Caaaalm down, caaalm down! Shorri about da...me matesh all kicked-off a bit, likhe. Anyway sha, I 'ope dat gives yuz a better, likhe, idea. Gotta do one now, sha, the bizzies are on de way. I can 'ear the sirens an' da... Posh: Air-hair-lair! It's AWFULLY sweet of you to ahsk ahftah pawsh! We get SO ignored these days, daintcha know? Rairly, this is THE quintiSENtial ehccent that you deLATEful little colonists think awv as British. Jolly good show, old chap, what? Now...Darjeeling or Assam? Carruthers!!!! Serve TEA, man. There's one of these little Americans here. Brummie: Yow ohroight? Buhrming-gum is the SICCOND biggest citay in the Yow-Kye and has the SIVINTH tallest skoi-scriper in Yowrup. Welsh: Welsh isn a LANGwedge, luhvli, it's a PO-em, inneh. We put a lodaa STRASS on certain SYllables and it goz ep an down like a song, inneh. LEHVli, it sounds, inneh. More art than AK-sent. Yorkshire: By 'eck. Boos is leht agenn. In Yarkshire wi dont call a spehd a spehd wi call it a SHOOVEL. An' we don't talk a lot anyway. Ah'll si thi... This was found HERE Hehe - any little Americans care for tea? Oh Carruthers!! On a slightly unrelated note... I think I have a reasonable idea what a geordie (newcastle) accent is like now.. many thanks to for being so patient with me lol. I am quite looking forward to tomorrows date now just so I can hear his cute accent! LOL.

I have been invited to a wedding on the 24th which I wasn't sure I would be able to go to, but have now confirmed I will be able to attend. I was talking with one of the bridesmaids this morning and she says "Oh you do realise its a handfasting? Its not a traditional wedding." 

Woah!!!

This is going to be so cool! I cant wait!

I am in a real grump today. Kids better not push ANY buttons or they will find themselves locked in bedrooms! Power's about to be disconnected because the wankstain hasn't paid up this month... what am I supposed to do? Pay the bills and forego feeding them??? Sheesh. Also, the nightclub I go dancing at is being closed by the end of the month. Damn redevelopers!

Gah... hormones!

To my wonderful flist - may the joy of the season be with you whatever beliefs you have! Have a wonderful long weekend, may the easter bunny bring you lots of chocolate and sleep! Hope you have fun on your days off work (for those that are lucky enough not to work) and make the most of it! Enjoy the company of your families and friends and the time you spend with them. Cherish the looks on the children's faces as they open their presents... and try not to kill them later that day when they are on a total sugar high. To celebrate the season I shall tell you a poem my mother used to read me as a little girl. It is still one of my favourites. I dont know who wrote it, I certainly didn't. There was a little rabbit who was laying in his burrow, when the dingo called him up to say he'd call on him tomorrow. The rabbit thought it better that the dingo did not meet him, so he found another burrow and the dingo did not eat him!

However, I have been writing this morning and listening to 70's and 80's gay disco anthems LOL!!

<lj-cut text="Sunday Morning">
The startling colours
of the rainbow lorikeet,
vibrant against
the pale skin of the ghost gum.
One small black cat 
gliding through the grass,
looking for a place
to lay her decaying body.
Chickens noisily scratch and lay
as I watch the clouds float
and cast shadows that dance
and weave across the grass.
And in the distance,
the sounds of traffic
interrupt my feeling 
of peace and solitude...
while I watch through the window
with the aroma of coffee
drifting across my nose
tickling my senses.

I've been trying to work out if I am a good parent, bad parent... or just plain odd when it comes to my anklebiters eating habits. Actually because of AB#3's medical probs we tend to eat a healthy varied diet... but everytime I do the shopping I get thinking. They all beg for me to buy pumpkin, rockmelon (canteloupe) etc... I've never seen anyone elses kids go so nuts in the produce section! "Please can we get some corn?? I LOVE corn!! Oh Oh they have asparagus!! Can we get that too? Mum!! Over here they have broccoli on sale!!" Yesterday I took the youngest shopping and popped into the healthfood shop (I love that place... I worked in one for a couple of years... bliss!) to get some gluten free puffed rice, and AB#4 spent ages begging for sugar free carob buds... and ate them happily when I bought 40c worth!
 
And just to top it off I made baked chicken breasts with steamed broccoli and mashed potato/pumpkin/sweet potato tonight... and 3 of them asked for seconds! Either my kids have weird eating habits.... or they are just nerds LOL.

Create your own drabble!! Drabble!! A Wand In Time On a smooth and glistening morning, Severus sat soaring in the air. It was Valentine's Day and he was all alone. His neck ached in sorrow for the secret love that he could never share. How could he expect Naya to love someone with a darkened thigh? Desperately, he began to recite a poem he had composed. "Ah, my love is like a quiet soft cauldren, all on a summer's day. I wish my Naya would push me, in her own bright way..." "Do you?" Naya sat down beside Severus and put her hand on Severus's chest. "I think that could be arranged." Severus gasped eagerly. "But what about my darkened thigh?" "I like it," Naya said smoothly. "I think it's orange." They came together and their kiss was like the darkness of a moonless night. "I love you," Severus said darkly. "I love you too," Naya replied and pushed him. They bought a hippogriff, moved in together, and lived sneeringly ever after.

I am 46% Goth

Goth ny night, normal by day. Deep in my heart I know I am evil, but not on the company's time. I do need to eat.

Take the Goth Test at fuali.com Actually this would be pretty accurate. during the day I am just "mum" blah blah.... but the black hair and clothes kinda give it away.

Yesterday was predicted to be 30c... reasonable weather, so my friend's hubby came over and I helped him build a new chicken pen. The girls are most happy! They now have an 8x10 shed with an 8x5 run. Wooden nesting boxes, and its all fully enclosed so they can go wherever! Problem was.... it was closer to 36c. I am now doing a nice impersonation of lobster girl... idiot me forgot the sunscreen! But the girls are happy... and thats what counts.. right? Cat is ok at the moment. Still plays and eating well. Losing weight though. I can now see the tumours sticking out her sides. :( She's starting to sway/limp a bit when she walks too, so I think it may have metastasized. Poor baby. AB#2 had her school assembly yesterday. One of the funniest presentations of Waltzing Matilda I have ever seen! LOL The swagman at one point jumped into the billabong by taking a flying leap off the stage onto a blue gym matt screaming "Aiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiieeeeee!!!!!"
